definition: to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: It took only half an hour by taxi from Congjiang county to Basha.
sentences.chinese: 从江县城打车到岜沙，只不过半个小时车程。

sentences.english: B: Not yet. I'll report the taxi and meal expenses later today.
sentences.chinese: 还没有，我今天晚些时候连打车和吃饭一起报销。

sentences.english: Not yet. I'll report the taximeal expenses later today.
sentences.chinese: 还没有，我今天晚些时候连打车和吃饭一起报销。

sentences.english: The singer left home and hailed a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 歌星出了家门，打车去酒店。

sentences.english: A: How about walking to the concert instead of taking a taxi?
sentences.chinese: 我们不打车，而是走着去音乐会怎么样？

sentences.english: Let's go to East Tomb Park by taxi.
sentences.chinese: 让我们打车去东陵公园吧。

sentences.english: because they have cars or can afford to take taxis everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们有车或者他们随处都可以打车。

sentences.english: How much should it cost to the Kunlun Hotel?
sentences.chinese: 打车到昆仑饭店需要多少钱？

sentences.english: Make sure you take enough money for the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 确认一下你打车的钱带够了没有。

sentences.english: Finally I decided to go there by taxi.
The buses and subway are all very convenient. You may also take a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 北京的公交车和地铁很方便，偶尔也可以打车。

sentences.english: Shichahai is not far away from here. We can get there by taxi.
sentences.chinese: 什刹海离这儿不太远，我们可以打车去。

sentences.english: The Didi Chuxing car-hailing app has more than 87% of the market in China.
sentences.chinese: 滴滴出行打车软件在中国的市场占有率超过87%。

sentences.english: but now that I live in the city I prefer to take the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 但自从住在城市里后，我比较喜欢打车了。

sentences.english: It's really unfair, ' the user said, adding, 'who is going to pay for my taxi?
sentences.chinese: 如果打车，一次就是几十块，我们的经济损失谁来管？

definition: to call a cab (by phone)/to request a ride (via an app)
to take the car, bus, train etc
passenger fare
taxi/(Tw) rental car
taxi driver
special (or reserved) train (or bus etc)/limousine/private car used as a taxi and booked via a smartphone app
to drive a car
public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
to run the meter (in a taxi)
to drive a vehicle for its owner (often as a paid service for sb who has consumed alcohol) (abbr. for 代理駕駛|代理驾驶[dai4 li3 jia4 shi3])/substitute driver (abbr. for 代駕司機|代驾司机[dai4 jia4 si1 ji1])
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
public transport vehicle/town bus/CL:輛|辆[liang4]
chauffeur/driver/CL:個|个[ge4]
a turntable
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
vehicle that gives one a free ride/(fig.) (ride on sb's) coattails/(take advantage of) an opportunity
fare/transport costs
